channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Stop romanticizing in-office watercooler talk. As a fully distributed company of 12,000 people, here’s what really works
item.description: Serendipitous in-office interactions are fun, but they have an adverse effect on the people who weren’t in that conversation.

item.title: Apple gets half of its revenue from iPhone sales. That’s only part of the story.
Coke pulls its latest ‘permanent’ flavor from store shelves after just six months
Fed’s Bowman says inflation remains a concern in U.S. despite progress
WEF Chair Klaus Schwab: It took just under 4 years to connect 1B people to vital digital services. We must redouble our efforts as the world enters the age of AI
item.description: 'Empowering 1 billion lives digitally is an extraordinary achievement—but it is only the beginning,' writes Klaus Schwab.

item.title: U.S. home prices are still rising — but at their slowest pace in eight months
People you’ve blocked on Twitter/X will now be able to see your posts again
item.description: But they won’t be able to interact.

item.title: U.S. consumer confidence recedes as November election nears
Perfectionism is not healthy or sustainable. Here’s what to strive for instead
item.description: There is a problem with tying our self-worth to our achievements so much that we fear to make mistakes.

item.title: U.S. stocks push higher as China’s balm to global markets arrives on Wall Street
